headline: JPMorgan Stock Drops After Bank Predicts $105 Billion in Expenses Next Year
summary: JPMorgan Chase’s stock fell more than 4.7% on Tuesday after the bank told investors that it will spend billions of dollars more in expenses next year.  At the Goldman Sachs conference in New York on Tuesday, consumer chief Marianne Lake told investors that the bank had just completed budgeting for next year and is planning to spend $105 billion, largely because of higher costs in her division.  The bank is expecting expenses this year to be $95.9 billion and analysts had anticipated approximately $101 billion of expenses next year, according to FactSet.

The bank is expecting expenses this year to be $95.9 billion and analysts had anticipated approximately $101 billion of expenses next year, according to FactSet.

headline: JPMorgan’s Stock Slide Weighs on Dow Industrials
summary: The blue-chip index fell 0.4%, dragged down by JPMorgan Chase shares, ahead of the Fed’s rate decision. The S&P 500 slipped 0.1%, while the Nasdaq added 0.1%.

headline: JPMorganChase Declares Common Stock Dividend
summary: NEW YORK, December 09, 2025--JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) ("JPMorganChase" or the "Firm") declared a quarterly dividend on the outstanding shares of the common stock of JPMorganChase. Information can be found on the Firm’s Investor Relations website at https://www.jpmorganchase.com/ir/news.

headline: Trump says he 'heard' Biden Fed appointments were signed by autopen, tells aide to investigate
summary: Trump's autopen comments came during a speech in Pennsylvania about the economy, aimed at countering Democrats' messaging about the U.S. affordability crisis.

headline: JPMorgan expects to spend $105B in 2026, Exxon lifts oil target
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) releasing its 2026 spending forecasts, Exxon Mobil (XOM) lifting its growth targets in earnings, cash flow, and oil production (CL=F, BZ=F), and AutoZone (AZO) stock dropping after reporting a fiscal first quarter earnings miss. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: JPMorgan Chase stock falls after Lake warns of fragile consumer environment
summary: Investing.com -- JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) stock fell 2.7% midday Tuesday after the bank’s consumer and community banking CEO Marianne Lake warned of a "bit more fragile" consumer environment at the Goldman Sachs financial services conference.

headline: Jopari collaborates with J.P. Morgan to enhance electronic claim payments

headline: J.P. Morgan Unveils 2026 Global Alternatives Outlook Highlighting Opportunities for Investors in Private Markets Amid the AI Boom
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management today released its eighth annual Global Alternatives Outlook, providing a 12-to-18 month outlook across key alternative asset classes, equipping investors to make tailored portfolio decisions. This year's report details our highest-conviction ideas as private markets mature into a structural mainstay of global finance.

headline: JPMorgan Hires Vaunted Berkshire Stockpicker as Buffett’s Exit Spurs C-Suite Shakeup
summary: On Monday Berkshire also announced that CFO Marc Hamburg, who has held the role for 40 years, plans to retire in June.
